ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛʼɛ́ nzse pà Yúndà, Yěsô gʉa mbʉ̀a tsɔ̌ tándá pafalísáyè léjÿó mmó. Epʉ̀a pie é laa wó é ńne ńdeŋe yé leŋ,
en: One Sabbath, when he went in to eat   at the house of one of the leading Pharisees,  # 14:1 Lk 7:36; 11:37 they were watching him closely.  # 14:1 Mk 3:2; Lk 6:7; 20:20

ngiemboon: ńgwaa gwɔ́, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ tyé mvfò yé, mbà kwɔ́ʼte lěen ńgwoon yé.
en: There in front of him was a man whose body was swollen with fluid.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te pafalísáyè pâ pakyagte mbʉ̌ Ssé pie é laa ndá ngie: «Áa na lepʉ̌ ségè péʼe, ńgwɔ́ gie ngwɔ́ mé gÿo nyìŋ zeŋe lyɛʼɛ́ nzse yégè kà ngǎŋ?»
en: In response, Jesus asked the law experts   and the Pharisees, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath or not? ”   # 14:3 Mt 12:2; Mk 3:4; Lk 6:2,9; 13:14; Jn 5:10

ngiemboon: Tá pɔ́ pú te tsɔ́b, Yěsô kíbe ngùɔ ŋwɛ́, ńgÿo á zéŋe, ńtsẅi á gʉa.
en: But they kept silent. He took the man, healed him, and sent him away.

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: «Awɔ̌ aa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi pɛ́ʼɛ̀ ńgwɔ́ gie míŋ we kà fòŋ ye wɔ́ɔ lɔɔn ńgwe tsɛ̀ɛ ntse ntǔŋ lyɛʼɛ́ nzse yégè, á nyé té sẅɛte éfó tsɛ̀ɛ wó ńkẅile yé?»
en: And to them, he said, “Which of you whose son or ox falls into a well, will not immediately pull him out on the Sabbath day? ”

ngiemboon: Á cʉa wɔ́b, pɔ́ zága pÿɛ̀.
en: They could find no answer to these things.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá páʼ pʉ̀a pie mé ně ńtóŋo wɔ́b ne ńkúu ndá, éfaʼa pɔ́ jʉʼ ye melÿò tá ńnéŋe, ésaga mbwó pɔ́b ngie:
en: He told a parable   to those who were invited, when he noticed how they would choose the best places  # 14:7 Lk 11:43 for themselves:

ngiemboon: «Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńtóŋo gú jʉʼʉ línɔ̀ɔn lɔ́ɔnndá, ɔ̀ kúu wó, ɔ̀ pɔ́ɔn lénéŋe na jʉʼʉ melÿò, ḿbɔ́gɔ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie à cʉa gú lépiŋ ńtó nzèm,
en: “When you are invited by someone to a wedding banquet, don’t sit in the place of honor, because a more distinguished person    than you may have been invited by your host.

ngiemboon: ngàŋ ndá gẅie à toŋó línɔ̀ɔn leen ńtó ńgɔɔn né gù ngie: “Lu ssé, andÿò wɔɔn néŋe,” mbà shʉ́ ge kúu gú légʉa ńnéŋe nzèm.
en: The one who invited both of you may come and say to you, ‘Give your place to this man,’ and then in humiliation, you will proceed to take the lowest place.

ngiemboon: Áa yɛ̌ ŋwɛ́ tá ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńtóŋo gú na línɔ̀ɔn, ɔ̀ tó ńnéŋe jú pɔ́ nzèm. Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńnéŋe jʉʼó, nyìŋ gẅie à ně ńtóŋo gú kúu ndá, ńgyá ɔ̀ gwɔ́ nzèm, á gɔɔn né gù ngie: “Ashǔ wɔ̀ɔn, tó lé mvfò,” mbà à lɔgɔ ńkwéʼe nzẅìŋ gú mvfò pʉ̀a metsèm pie pi lâ pɔ̌ ee ndá.
en: “But when you are invited, go and sit in the lowest place, so that when the one who invited you comes, he will say to you, ‘Friend, move up higher.’ You will then be honored    in the presence of all the other guests.   # 14:10 Pr 25:6–7; 29:23

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, nyìŋ lɔɔn ńŋáʼte nnɛ́, mbà mé ge sẅíʼi yé é náa ssé, ésẅíʼi mbùm ye ńnáa ssé, mbà mé ge pʉʼʉ yé tÿɔ́g tÿɔ́g.»
en: For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, and the one who humbles himself will be exalted.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋ ńgɔɔn mbwó nyìŋ gẅie à ně ńtóŋo yé ngie: «Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ne ńtóŋo línɔ̀ɔn, fʉ̀ʼʉ zsǒ kà ncwònzém wɔ́ɔ, te tóŋ meshǔ pú, kà mefɛ̌ pú wɔ́ɔ, kà pʉ̀a na tsìŋendá gí wɔ́ɔ, kà megàŋ nkwɔʼɔ́ mbʉ̀a pú pie ée megàŋ nkáb wɔ́ɔ, á nue pɔ́ ge gÿo gíŋ tóŋo gú jú, é lɔg tsɔ́ʼ shʉ́ʼ gú.
en: He also said to the one who had invited him, “When you give a lunch or a dinner, don’t invite your friends, your brothers or sisters, your relatives, or your rich neighbors, because they might invite you back, and you would be repaid.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńdáʼ ńne ńtóŋo línɔ̀ɔn, ɔ̀ tóŋ pate mmó, ńtóŋ menkǒon, ńtóŋ menkèmekwò, ńtóŋ mefʉ̀menÿɔ́g.
en: On the contrary, when you host a banquet,    invite those who are poor, maimed, lame, or blind.   # 14:13 Lv 22:22; Lk 14:21

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ gÿo púʼu, mbà ɔɔ shÿó mbòŋo, mélàʼmie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ le péen gú na fàʼ jú wɔ́, púʼu la, e Ssé zɔ láʼ péen gú na fàʼ jú, á fʉ̀ʼ gie pʉ̀a pé ge láʼ zíme na legwé.»
en: And you will be blessed, because they cannot repay you; for you will be repaid    at the resurrection of the righteous.”   # 14:14 Ac 24:15

ngiemboon: Mé júʼu yɔɔn shwóŋè tà tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie pâ pɔ̌ la néŋe ssé, ńne ńjÿó mmó gɔɔn mbwó Yěsô ngie: «Ashÿó mbòŋo aa nyìŋ gẅie à ge láʼ jÿó yé mmó tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Ssé!»
en: When   one of those who reclined at the table with him heard these things, he said to him, “Blessed is the one who will eat bread in the kingdom of God! ”  # 14:15 Lk 13:29; 22:16,30; Rv 19:9

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ lǎʼ ńtáŋte máamáa línɔ̀ɔn, ńtsẅii mbwó pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: Then he told him, “A man was giving a large banquet and invited many.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼʉ léjÿó shúm gÿo ńkuʼ, á túmo ménkʉ́ we ngie à gʉa ńtóŋo wɔ́b ngie pɔ́ leen ńké ńtó fʉ̀ʼɔɔn.
en: At the time of the banquet, he sent his servant to tell those who were invited, ‘Come, because everything is now ready.’

ngiemboon: Táʼ, pɔ́ metsèm pú faʼ ndilétaŋ lélɔg ńtsó línɔ̀ɔn. Amvɔ̀gmvfò gɔɔn ngie: “N ka jú nkáʼ, á poŋ n gʉa ńgyá, tsetsɔ́ʼ, shwóŋo yé ngie n te tó wɔ́.”
en: “But without exception    they all began to make excuses. The first one said to him, ‘I have bought a field, and I must go out and see it. I ask you to excuse me.’

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ gɔɔn ngie: “N ka jú mefòŋ legém lélɔg faʼa fàʼ, n ne faʼa légʉa ńzẅíʼ, tsetsɔ́ʼ gɔɔn ngie tà á láʼa wɔ́ɔn.”
en: “Another said, ‘I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I’m going to try them out. I ask you to excuse me.’

ngiemboon: Wetsɔ̌ gɔɔn ngie: “N ka nyě ńzɔ́ʼɔ, ngwɔ́ ń de tó.”
en: “And another said, ‘I just got married,    and therefore I’m unable to come.’

ngiemboon: Ménkʉ́ ŋwɛ́ piŋ nzèm, éshwóŋo tá we páʼ pɔ́ gɔ̌ɔn, á pú ńgyáŋa yé tɛʼ, á gíŋ ńtúmo ménkʉ́ ŋwɛ́, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: “Kÿote lê tʉ̀, ńgʉa tÿǒsoŋ ńtyé metwó nzsè, ńgiŋe na melyěen nzsè, ńtóŋ pate mmó, ńtóŋ menkǒon, mbɔɔ mefʉ̀menÿɔ́g pâ menkèmekwò pi lâ pɔ̌ tó.”
en: “So the servant came back and reported these things to his master. Then in anger, the master of the house told his servant, ‘Go out quickly into the streets and alleys of the city, and bring in here the poor, maimed, blind, and lame.’

ngiemboon: Á gʉa tà ḿbiŋ, ńgɔɔn né tá we ngie: “Andè, m bǔ ńgÿo mmó gie ɔ̀ ně ńtsẅi, n něŋ pʉ̀a ndá táʼ, ajʉʼ nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó.”
en: “ ‘Master,’ the servant said, ‘what you ordered has been done, and there’s still room.’

ngiemboon: Tá we júʼ ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: “Gʉa metwó nzsè fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, mbɔɔ na melyěen nzsè tsɛ̀ɛ mbʉ̀a, wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ gẅie ɔ̀ gyǎ, ɔ̀ lɔg tʉ̀, ńtóŋo yé ngie à tó. Ɔ̀ ge néŋe wɔ́b něŋ tà ndá yɔɔn lúe.
en: “Then the master told the servant, ‘Go out into the highways and hedges and make them come in, so that my house may be filled.

ngiemboon: Zsé mboŋó ngie, ngwɔ́ tsɔ̌ tàʼ na pʉ̀a pie n ka vɔg ńtsẅii mbwó pɔ́b la, á le gÿo ńzẅíʼi mmó léjÿó yɔ́ɔn mɔ́.”»
en: For I tell you, not one of those people who were invited will enjoy my banquet.’ ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ, ńcʉ́me mánzsè ńne ńgiŋe, epʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn gwɔ́ nzèm yé, á kúu tsɔ́ jʉʼ, ésele nnɛ́ ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie:
en: Now   great crowds were traveling with him. So he turned and said to them,

ngiemboon: «Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńcʉ́me nzèm mèŋ, à te kwoŋo wɔ́ɔn ńcʉa tá we, ńcʉa má we, ńcʉa nzwě we, ńcʉa penkʉ́ pé, ńcʉa mefɛ̌ pé pembàŋa mbɔɔ pepanzwě, ńcʉa mbɔɔ kwàʼ twó mbùm yé wɔ́, mbà à te kuʼu légwɔ́ ngàŋakwò wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́.
en: “If anyone comes to me    and does not hate   # 14:26 Dt 21:15; 22:13; 24:3; Lk 16:13 his own father and mother, wife and children, brothers and sisters #— #yes, and even his own life #— #he cannot be my disciple.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn te kaa yé tÿǒnkǐ ńdɔg ńcʉ́me nzèm mèŋ wɔ́, mbà ngwɔ́ á le kuʼu légwɔ́ ngàŋakwò wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́.
en: Whoever does not bear his own cross    and come after me cannot be my disciple.

ngiemboon: Ngwɔ́ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ na pi le ne ńgee ńkwɛ́ɛ máa ndá, ńnyé té zɔɔn ḿvɔg ńnéŋe ssé, ńkwaŋte nzẅìŋ nkáb gie ngwɔ́ á lɔg ńkwɛ́ tà ńgyá kà à kuʼu lékwɛ́ tà ḿmag mefàʼ wɔ́ɔ wɔ́,
en: “For which of you, wanting to build a tower, doesn’t first sit down and calculate the cost    to see if he has enough to complete it?

ngiemboon: ḿbɔ́gɔ lénuŋe cÿó, endá cʉa yé. Mé láʼa ńzɔ́gɔ ńgyá ńgẅe yé ngie:
en: Otherwise, after he has laid the foundation and cannot finish it, all the onlookers will begin to ridicule him,

ngiemboon: “Gyá páʼ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ wa la zye ndá, à te kuʼu lémege wɔ́.”
en: saying, ‘This man started to build and wasn’t able to finish.’

ngiemboon: Kà pɔ́ fùɔ túm gẅie à ne ńcwoŋte mbùm ye légʉa ńdÿɔ́ʼɔ wetsɔ̌ fùɔ túm gẅie à kěm ncù wɔ́ɔ, mbà à ge sáŋ pé pʉ̀a, é gyá ngie kà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á lɔg pʉ̀a ntsáʼ legém, ńgʉa ńdÿɔ́ʼɔ wetsɔ̌ fùɔ gẅie à ne ńdɔgɔ pʉ̀a ntsáʼ móm mbʉ́a ńtóo wɔ́ɔ?
en: “Or what king, going to war against another king, will not first sit down and decide if he is able with ten thousand to oppose the one who comes against him with twenty thousand?

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńgyá, epé pʉ̀a kɔ́g, mbà fùɔ gẅie à ne ńdɔgɔ ncù ńtóo, à ge nyé gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a, à túmo mámekěm, à gʉa sẅíŋte yé ngie à shwóŋo yé mmó gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á ná tá néŋe né mbʉ́lè.
en: If not, while the other is still far off, he sends a delegation and asks for terms of peace.

ngiemboon: Yěsô maʼa twó ngie: Áa ndʉŋndʉŋ púʼu, nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, à te vɔg ńnyé shúm ntsèm sie à gẅiin wɔ́, mbà à te kuʼu légwɔ́ ngàŋakwò wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́.
en: In the same way, therefore, every one of you who does not renounce    all his possessions   # 14:33 Mt 19:21; Php 3:7; Heb 11:26 cannot be my disciple.

ngiemboon: Engwáŋ áa mmó mbòŋo táʼ, ńgwɔ́ gie é lɔɔn ńcʉ́ʼʉ ńdebe lebe, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé gÿo lêkɔ́ tà é gíŋe ńdʉm?
en: “Now,    salt   # 14:34 Jdg 9:45; Mk 9:50 is good, but if salt should lose its taste, how will it be made salty?

ngiemboon: Mɛ̌ ngwáŋ ngwɔ́ é ké le tsetsáʼ kẅéte, à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ mé le lɔg ńgÿo kʉ̀ŋe wɔ́, mé ŋwá ḿmaʼa pǐ. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin metuŋó lélɔg ńjúʼu nò, á júʼ.»
en: It isn’t fit for the soil or for the manure pile; they throw it out. Let anyone who has ears to hear listen.”
